<![CDATA[CBC | Canada News ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/canada/?cmp=rss en-ca Sun, 18 Feb 2018 11:35:17 EST CBC.ca http://www.cbc.ca/rss/image/cbc_144.gif http://www.cbc.ca/news/?cmp=rss <![CDATA[Trudeau, with family in tow, visits India's famed Taj Mahal]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/trudeau-state-visit-india-1.4541128?cmp=rss 1.4541128 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 08:46:55 EST The Canadian Press News/Politics

Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and his family took a tour of the famed Taj Mahal and visited an elephant-rescue sanctuary north of Agra, on the first full day of a week-long visit to India.

]]> <![CDATA[Becca Schofield, N.B. teen who inspired #BeccaToldMeTo campaign, has died]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/new-brunswick/becca-schofield-beccatoldmetoo-has-died-1.4541134?cmp=rss 1.4541134 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 08:48:19 EST Sarah Petz News/Canada/New Brunswick

Becca Schofield, the teen whose campaign to spread kindness became a global movement, has died.

]]> <![CDATA['Slippery slope': Opposition mounts to Canadian media's plan to block piracy websites]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/fairplay-piracy-website-blocking-crtc-1.4539566?cmp=rss 1.4539566 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Sophia Harris News/Business

Opposition is mounting to a coalition’s plan to block Canadians from accessing piracy websites. Many Canadians fear that the plan — backed by media companies such as Bell, Rogers and CBC — could lead to rampant internet censorship

]]> <![CDATA[Ross Rebagliati's 'wild ride' from Olympic podium to pot merchant]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/thenational/ross-rebagliati-olympics-snowboard-cannabis-marijuana-1.4519928?cmp=rss 1.4519928 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Ian Hanomansing News/The National

Snowboard legend Ross Rebagliati is hoping to capitalize on both his Olympic drive and his connections with cannabis to strike gold again - this time through a new business venture.

]]> <![CDATA[Helping Haiti: Bibeau begins 3-day visit focused on improving health, empowering women ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/haiti-bibeau-health-women-1.4539678?cmp=rss 1.4539678 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Kathleen Harris News/Politics

International Development Minister Marie-Claude Bibeau is travelling to Haiti today to begin a three-day trip focusing on improving health and empowering women in the disaster-plagued, impoverished nation.

]]> <![CDATA[Gerald Stanley due back in court to face charges he improperly stored 7 guns]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatoon/gerald-stanley-court-charges-improperly-stored-guns-1.4538790?cmp=rss 1.4538790 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Guy Quenneville News/Canada/Saskatoon

The legal troubles of Gerald Stanley, the Saskatchewan farmer acquitted in the shooting death of Colten Boushie, are slated to carry over into provincial court next month.

]]> <![CDATA[Vancouver artist's cartoon of Florida school shooting resonates]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/british-columbia/vancouver-artist-s-cartoon-of-florida-school-shooting-resonates-1.4540961?cmp=rss 1.4540961 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 20:28:40 EST The Canadian Press News/Canada/British Columbia

"It gave me a little lump in my throat when the idea (for the cartoon) first kind of popped up."

]]> <![CDATA[Jagmeet Singh doesn't want to be timid, but it's still not clear how bold he will be]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/jagmeet-singh-ndp-convention-analysis-wherry-1.4540911?cmp=rss 1.4540911 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Aaron Wherry News/Politics

With delegates to the NDP policy convention cheering for the promise of proportional representation, Jagmeet Singh declared that "the time to be timid was over" and then he spoke of "courage." But the extent of Singh's courageousness is still taking shape.

]]> <![CDATA[Hedley allegations put spotlight on music industry in wake of #MeToo]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/entertainment/hedley-allegations-music-industry-1.4541231?cmp=rss 1.4541231 Sun, 18 Feb 2018 11:35:17 EST The Canadian Press News/Entertainment

Allegations of sexual misconduct swirling around pop-rockers Hedley have put the spotlight on an industry long defined by the mantra of sex, drugs and rock 'n' roll — but several music veterans believe a powerful change is already well underway.

]]> <![CDATA['A tragic loss': Winnipeg says final goodbye to boy hit by truck at crosswalk ]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/manitoba/surafiel-musse-tesfamariam-funeral-winnipeg-1.4540634?cmp=rss 1.4540634 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 12:42:10 EST Austin Grabish News/Canada/Manitoba

Hundreds of people gathered Saturday to say goodbye to an eight-year-old Winnipeg boy who was killed crossing the street at a crosswalk with his mom.

]]> <![CDATA[Indian migrant workers file complaint over temple work with Ontario government]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/indian-migrant-worker-ministry-labour-wages-complaint-1.4540824?cmp=rss 1.4540824 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 17:13:20 EST By Desmond Brown News/Canada/Toronto

Two migrant workers from India who say they faced harsh living conditions and were drastically underpaid as sculptors at a Hindu religious charity organization in Toronto are seeking thousands of dollars in unpaid wages from the Carnforth Road-based temple.

]]> <![CDATA[Canadians take more money out of retirement savings to pay for expenses: survey]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/rrsp-retirement-savings-1.4538878?cmp=rss 1.4538878 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Rajeshni Naidu-Ghelani News/Business

Canadians are withdrawing more money from their retirement savings to pay for short-term expenses despite the tax consequences, according to a new bank survey.

]]> <![CDATA['We were innocent': How one survivor hopes to get justice for Duplessis Orphans]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/montreal/duplessis-orphans-class-action-1.4537218?cmp=rss 1.4537218 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Jaela Bernstien News/Canada/Montreal

Marc Boudreau, now 62, is trying to take seven Catholic organizations, along with the federal and provincial governments, to court for the abuse he said he suffered as a child.

]]> <![CDATA[Singh gets 91% support in 1st NDP leadership review]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/jagmeet-singh-convention-ndp-speech-1.4540597?cmp=rss 1.4540597 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 11:50:04 EST CBC News News/Politics

Federal NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh's first leadership review vote ended positively, with 90.7 per cent of delegates at the convention in Ottawa voting against holding another leadership race.

]]> <![CDATA['The pilot called mayday': Tailpipe flames force plane to return to Saskatoon airport]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatoon/mayday-saskatoon-airport-plane-air-canada-jazz-flight-8585-1.4540900?cmp=rss 1.4540900 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 18:15:14 EST Ashleigh Mattern News/Canada/Saskatoon

A fire on an Air Canada Express plane forced an emergency landing at the Saskatoon airport on Saturday.

]]> <![CDATA[Trudeau's India mission mixes global business with local politics]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/trudeau-india-trade-trip-1.4540238?cmp=rss 1.4540238 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 04:00:00 EST Evan Dyer News/Politics

Two-way trade between Canada and India amounts to only about $8 billion annually — a number Prime Minister Justin Trudeau hopes to improve with an official visit that begins this weekend. He has multiple meetings planned with Indian CEOs and business leaders over the coming days.

]]> <![CDATA[Tributes pour in for Greg (Bird Dog) Smyth after Baby Leafs legend loses fight with cancer]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/newfoundland-labrador/greg-smyth-st-johns-maple-leafs-nhl-ahl-1.4540604?cmp=rss 1.4540604 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 12:38:51 EST Ryan Cooke News/Canada/NL

There are plenty of messages of love and laughter following the death of a longtime hockey enforcer, who was "more of a Newfoundlander" than most.

]]> <![CDATA[PC leadership candidates prepare for a 'shootout at the OK Corral' as Brown enters race]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/political-fratricide-1.4540379?cmp=rss 1.4540379 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 10:55:11 EST CBC News News/Canada/Toronto

Patrick Brown's entry into the Ontario Progressive Conservative leadership race could result in dangerous party in-fighting, experts say.

]]> <![CDATA[Public health officials warn of possible measles exposure on Air Canada flight]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/toronto/public-health-officials-warn-of-possible-measles-exposure-on-air-canada-flight-1.4540738?cmp=rss 1.4540738 Sat, 17 Feb 2018 13:56:13 EST The Canadian Press News/Canada/Toronto

Public health officials west of Toronto say they've confirmed a case of the measles in a baby who returned home on a flight from Switzerland.

]]> <![CDATA[PepsiCo shuts down Alberta Spitz sunflower seed factory]]> http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/spitz-factory-alberta-1.4540237?cmp=rss 1.4540237 Fri, 16 Feb 2018 22:12:24 EST Sarah Rieger News/Canada/Calgary

Thirty years after Spitz sunflower seeds first sprouted in Alberta, the last factory in the province is set to shut down.
